current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To limit the level of premium subsidy provided by the Federal Crop Insurance Corporation to
			 agricultural producers.

committee-name.#text: Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by adding at the end the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section 508(e) of the Federal Crop Insurance
			 Act

header.#text:
Limitation on payment of
			 portion of premium by Corporation

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
on behalf of a
			 person or legal
				entity, directly or indirectly, with respect to all policies issued
			 to the
				person or legal entity under this title for a crop year shall be
			 limited to a
				maximum of $70,000.

text.#text:
Notwithstanding any other provision of this title, the
				total amount of premium paid by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall carry out this paragraph in accordance with

text.#text: To the maximum extent practicable, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 1001 of
			 the Food
				Security Act of 1985

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 S2201 IS: To limit the level of premium subsidy provided by the Federal Crop Insurance Corporation to agricultural producers.
